title: Financial Report Request (University of Tennessee, Knoxville)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) I would like a copy of the annual NCAA MFRS report for FY2017 - FY2025. These annual reports are submitted by the athletic department and record the revenue/expenses of the department. It is an approximately 90 page document listing revenue and expenses in the athletic department by team. It is a standard annual NCAA form. The latest FY2025 report was due, 1/15/2025 so should be available. If you are unable to include this, can you please specify if you will send it to me immediately when it's available or if you want me to make a new request. That should be 9 reports combined.

2) I'd like copies of the latest contracts for your athletic director and head coaches of football, mens/womens basketball, and mens/womens ice hockey if you have those teams. That should be 6 documents if you have that many teams.

Please let me know if you have any questions. Thank you for your time.

Best,

Greg Chick

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Greg Chick.

title: Public Records Request – Yearly Administration of University-Administered Safe Leave (ORS 659A)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request records concerning how the University of Oregon has administered University-administered safe leave under ORS 659A.270–659A.285 from January 1, 2016 to the present.

This request is limited to situations in which the University itself evaluated, approved, denied, limited, or redirected leave for ORS 659A-qualifying purposes. I am not requesting personally identifying information.

Please provide the following, organized by calendar year (2016–present):

1. The total number of requests for University-administered safe leave (paid, unpaid, or in conjunction with accrued leave), broken down by:

   - qualifying purpose category under ORS 659A.272, and
   - outcome (approved, denied, redirected to another leave category, delayed, or otherwise modified).

2. For any denials, delays, or redirections, records sufficient to show:

   - the year of the determination,
   - the qualifying purpose category under ORS 659A.272, and
   - the stated reason for the denial, delay, limitation, or redirection.

3. Any aggregate summaries, tracking records, or reports the University maintains that reflect how ORS 659A University-administered safe leave has been administered over time.

4. Identification of where the University has posted or maintained the notices required under ORS 659A.279 and ORS 659A.283, including:

   - physical posting locations,
   - electronic locations where those notices have been made available to employees (including remote employees), and
   - the dates those notices were in effect at those locations.

5. Any records, guidance, training materials, or communications indicating that:

   - certain qualifying purposes were treated as atypical or outside normal use,
   - eligibility was evaluated based on the nature of the allegation or proceeding rather than the statutory criteria, or
   - certification from a health-care or service provider was considered insufficient under ORS 659A.280.

6. A year-by-year numerical summary of the number of times the University notified complainants who alleged they were victims of conduct covered by ORS 659A.272 of the availability of University-administered safe leave protections, as required under the notice obligations set forth in ORS 659A.279 and ORS 659A.283, including:

    - the office providing the notice (e.g., OEOA/OICRC, Human Resources, HR Leaves, Workplace ADA, Employee & Labor Relations, or other),
    - the category of qualifying conduct or bias identified (reported only by category and count),
    - any records or aggregate data reflecting whether notification or access to safe leave was tracked, administered, or categorized differently based on the type of alleged bias (for example, disability-related complaints, ADA retaliation, race,       
       sex/gender, or other protected categories), and
    - any aggregate records reflecting how or when such notice was provided as part of complaint or response processes pursuant to ORS 659A.279 and ORS 659A.283.


Names and identifying details are not requested and may be redacted.

Clarification regarding parallel processes:

To avoid any confusion, this public records request is submitted pursuant to Oregon Public Records Law only and does not waive, replace, or otherwise affect any requests, grievances, or RFIs I have submitted through my union or any other employment-related process, many of which remain pending.

This request is submitted because I require timely access to records necessary to understand my statutory protections and to plan accordingly. The public records process is the only mechanism currently available to obtain this information within a reasonable timeframe.

Please provide the records electronically. If the information is maintained in summary or report form, those summaries are sufficient.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kelvin Shivers II

title: Autopsy report for Baby Bennett of Booneville

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Autopsy report for Baby Bennett of Booneville
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I'm a reporter seeking the autopsy report for the fetus related to Deeann Bennett and Charles Bennett of Booneville, who were indicted in January 2026 and arrested in February 2026.

The state is pressing charges without releasing information about the estimated gestational age of the fetus, which is relevant to the charges at hand. 

State police referred to the fetus as an "infant" and a "baby" in its press releases (https://www.kentuckystatepolice.ky.gov/news/p7-11-29-2024) and that language is showing up in news coverage of the incident, which could prejudice a potential jury and harm the defendants' reputation and financial standing.

This report is a matter of public interest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Susan Rinkunas
